name: Melissa Wasi

reviews.text: I teach spiritual retreats and there is no better place than Melissa Was I in Pisaq. We loved the people, the rooms, the food at the Trattoria and the Blue Llama Cafe in town. All of our requests were accommodated and we had a great retreat.
reviews.title: Best place in Pisac. Great place for a retreat.

reviews.text: Joyce and Chito, the owners are lovely and very helpful. Someone from our group needed medical help (don't drink Chicha in the street!) and Joyce spend a whole day taking care of him. Thank you Joyce.
reviews.title: Basic rooms, welcoming host, lovely garden

reviews.text: We stayed here in October 2012 for one night with a friend. We were welcomed very graciously and visited with the host in a comfortable living room with a fire in the hearth. We were also able to eat our little repast here that we had brought. The rooms are in separate cabanas in a nice garden. Basic, clean, no heat, secure. The beds are lumpy, but did not keep us from sleeping soundly, because it is so quiet. Trees, lots of greenery and flowers, and an Italian restaurant on site with an American chef. Restaurant is closed Mon and Tues. Delicious home-made granola with quinoa for breakfast, and cooked eggs. The son of the host performs rituals using hallucinogenic roots--his father tells us people come from all over the world for these sessions. The hotel is hard to find because it is set apart from the main village, but all the taxis know where it is, and they are cheap and plentiful. The host also runs the Blue Llama restaurant in the center of Pisaq; food is very good there and they also have fruit smoothies and an ATM.
reviews.title: Melissa Wasi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Melissa Wasi with a group of friends the end of June 2012. We got there at night and it was very dark with loud music playing and a "purging ceremony" going on---very weird. The rooms were comfortable and the food was good. Beware that there were RATS running up and down the walls of the restaurant. The restaurant was built into the side of a mountain so it was interesting to see but still the rats were a big worry. Some of the guys in our group heard them banging around the kitchen in the evening. We mentioned it to the owner and he just smiled.
reviews.title: Tranquil, welcoming and great showers

reviews.text: Situated outside the hustle and bustle of the touristy area and close to the river this B&B first welcomes you with a sign, "Mi casa es tu casa" and they mean it. We arrived after dark and without a reservation and the owner greeted us with a friendly smile and said, "no problem." He then welcomed us into his personal residence for a fireside chat. The experience was a nice change from the austerity of some hotels and the down-to-earth nature of owner and well-kept grounds made for a very pleasant stay. Also- BEST showers in South America and the cleanest accommodations. Highly recommended for travelers that want more than just a room.
reviews.title: basic lodging in serene setting

reviews.text: Joyce and Chito, the owners, will do anything to make your stay so beautiful. They bring hospitality really to a different level. They live hospitality from their hearts. They inspire their staff to do the same! Melissa Wasi is the dreamspot in the valley. Surrounded by a beautiful garden where many hummingbirds love to stay. The rooms are located in original made houses of adobe, which create a wonderful atmosphere. They are very helpful in organizing you trip and know a lot of beautiful locations.
reviews.title: More than you can dream.

reviews.text: We chose Melissa Wasi to start our trip in the Sacred Valley. Because we have never been at altitudes higher than 2 km before, we decided to get acclimatized in the Valley before going up to Cusco and other places higher than 3 km. We stayed 2 nights in the bungalow B3 facing a newly built restaurant. We enjoyed our stay. The hosts are wonderful people ready to help with everything. They arranged a taxi to pick up us at airport. They called a taxi and provided walking sticks for our trip to Pisac ruins. When we found that TV in our room lacks DVD player, we asked the hosts and they sent a person who brought a player and connected it to TV. Every evening, a person appeared in our bungalow to start a fireplace for us. The only problem, I could not figure out how to stop smoke from seeping into the room. Aside from this, everything was great. We liked flowers, beautiful garden, and mountain scenery. We also liked the new restaurant building that uses natural rock as one of its walls.
reviews.title: Great place-wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This bed and breakfast is nestled on a pristine piece of land framed with breathtaking views.
reviews.title: Like Home in Paradise

reviews.text: Chito, the owner, (his wife Joyce was out of town) greeted my fiance and I when we arrived and showed us to our room. His sincerity and genuine hospitality were refreshing to say the least.
reviews.title: Beautiful location - great hosts - room avg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 4 which was a sweet space including a comfortable bed and a brightly sun-lit bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay with delicious food!

reviews.text: Our group of seven spent one night at Melissa Wasi at the beginning of a week long tour of the Sacred Valley. And that would be my only regret, that it was just one night! We were instantly made to feel at home, and the views from the property are just wonderful. Tired and hungry, we enjoyed a delicious dinner in the on site restaurant, followed by a good night's sleep. Breakfast was included and served in the restaurant the next morning. The pancakes put smiles on our faces. This place is popular with retreat groups. The grounds are large and beautifully kept, the owner very kind, and the staff lovely.
reviews.title: Serene Setting and Warm Welcome

reviews.text: My friends and I always stay here when we are visiting the area of Pisac.
reviews.title: Magical, Peaceful and Rejuvenating
